instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
Hi there,

I have a m1 2020 (battery was completely flat, would not power on)which gets 20V over USB Charger but with almost 0A draw (0.04A) with battery removed board only. Sometimes goes a bit up.

I moved the board to a working case and it powers on loads accounts etc but doesnt charge battery. So the logic board itself seems fine, however there is a problem with USB / Charging.

so summarized: Board works in a different case with a charged battery. Battery in the original case is flat (wont power on in there, because probably didnt charge anymore) Powered on in the other case i got 20V 0,1A draw but no charging.

how can i further troubleshoot ? I ordered the cd3217b12 chips, but as i get 20V shouldnt that mean they are probably fine ? What should i measure and continue to troubleshoot.  Boardview and shematics i have.

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Please, confirm what MLB you have; <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2016), not M1 (2020) machine.
Do not tocuh USB-C are yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message: copy paste mistake ofc <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
If USB-C input switch to 20V without battery, the probleem should not be on USB-C area.
First, check the level for <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> signals.
You can force the detection joining <RESISTOR>R5155</RESISTOR> pads.

Also check voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; before, and after UD200/1.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
Measures without battery connected

<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL>  3,8V
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL>  0V

1.8V SDA on RD203 left side
1.8V SCL on RD202 left side

around 1.3V SDA on RD201 bottom side
around 1.3V SCL on RD200 top side

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
You sould check all SCL/SDA lines of UD200/1; in diode mode also.

With the good battery, this board shows its percentage correctly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
Measures without battery connected

Voltage:

<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> 3,8V
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> 0V

1.8V SDA on RD203 left side
1.8V SCL on RD202 left side

around 1.3V SDA on RD201 bottom side
around 1.3V SCL on RD200 top side

3.3V SDA on RD208
3.3 SCL on RD207

Diode Mode:

SDA on RD203 = 1.89
CDL on RD202 =1.89

SDA on RD201 = 1.7
SDA on RD200 =1.7

SDA on RD208 = 1.77
SCL on RD207 = 1.77

I just got myself a new battery to test the board. It boots up fine, battery indicator STUCK shows all the time 32%... Amp draw 0,1A at 20V.. no charging

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message: Remember to check diode mode with red probe on ground; black probe on test point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
oops sorry:

SDA on RD203 = 0.522
CDL on RD202 = 0.530

SDA on RD201 = 0.308
SDA on RD200 = 0.308

SDA on RD208 = 0.473
SCL on RD207 = 0.476

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
One of UD200/1 may be bad.
You can also try DFU mode, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
Thanks!

2 questions, and sorry about that I’m quite new to macbook repairs. Usually I do consoles and stuff.

1) is there a source to source UD200 / 1 ? I don’t have a donor as Im not a repair shop. Soldering is no problem.

2) DFU I tried, I have another working m1 I repaired and I put the broken one in dfu mode, in Apple Configurator I chose „repair“ , but at some point on installing system it always reboots and doesn’t finish dfu restore… not sure if I chose the right option.

Thank you very much!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 20V on USB but no charging
threads.message:
You can try revive in DFU.
But, if no data to save, go for restore.
